doc:
Wee Willie Davis https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Wee_Willie_Davis 0 William "Wee Willie" Davis (December 7, 1906 – April 9, 1981) was an American film actor and professional wrestler. He was born in New York City and died in Louisville, Kentucky, aged 74. He worked in the Jefferson County Jail in Louisville in 1972–75 as the gym guard. He was also an engineer and contributed to the invention of the Glowmeter, an early Heads up display that projected a car's speed onto the windshield. A fellow wrestler, "Prince Ilaki Ibn Ali Hassan" (real name Agisilaki Mihalakis), who also fought as the "Mad Greek", was the primary inventor. William_"_Wee_Willie_"_Davis ( December_7_,_1906 – April_9 , 1981 ) was an_American_film_actor and professional_wrestler . He was_born in New_York_City and died in Louisville_,_Kentucky_,_aged_74 . He worked in the_Jefferson_County_Jail in Louisville in 1972 – 75 as the_gym_guard . He was also an_engineer and contributed to the_invention of the_Glowmeter , an_early Heads up_display that projected a_car 's_speed onto the_windshield . A_fellow_wrestler , " Prince_Ilaki_Ibn_Ali_Hassan " ( real_name_Agisilaki_Mihalakis_) , who also fought as the_"_Mad_Greek_" , was the_primary_inventor .
